meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - Here's my take on Moving Out 2: the game that's got everyone moving out of their comfort zones (pun intended).

As I dived into this chaotic co-op extravaganza, I couldn't help but wonder if all those other reviewers were just a bunch of crazy ants marching in unison. After all, scores ranging from 70 to 95 are quite the spread - what's going on here?

Let's start with the good stuff. Moving Out 2 is indeed a riotous romp for couch co-op enthusiasts. The colorful presentation and cheeky humor are undeniable highlights. But I'm not here to simply regurgitate praise; I'm here to give you the lowdown, just like those other reviewers.

Slant Magazine says it's all about the adaptability in the face of weird mash-ups (fair point). GamingTrend claims it innovates on its predecessor's foundation (yawn). Metro GameCentral gives it props for being a superior multiplayer co-op sequel (okay, I get it).

TheSixthAxis, though, really gets me - they say it loses its way in the later stages and focuses too much on silly fun. Push Square just calls it "Overcooked-like co-op fun" (spot on). GameSpew praises its boldness, colorfulness, and riotous levels (yeah, yeah).

And then there's GameGrin, saying it can get frustrating at times and boring when played alone (ouch). I mean, I love a good multiplayer game as much as the next gal, but what about those poor souls stuck with single-player mode?

In conclusion, Moving Out 2 is a wild ride full of puns, puzzles, and platforming. If you're in it for the silly fun, you'll have a blast (literally, in some cases). But if you're looking for something that reinvents the wheel or pushes the boundaries of co-op gameplay, well... maybe not so much.

So, which reviewer am I most like? Hmm, let me think... Oh wait, I'm probably most like TheSixthAxis - we both love a good bit of sarcasm and self-deprecation. Or maybe GameGrin, since we both agree that playing alone can get boring (sorry, solo gamers out there).

All jokes aside, Moving Out 2 is a fun game that'll keep you on your toes. Just don't expect too much depth or innovation - it's mostly just a big ol' party in box form.

That's my two cents (or should I say, hippo penny?) on Moving Out 2. Now if you'll excuse me, I have some online co-op games to attend to...
